thinking.disposable_income: The neighborhood has relatively high disposable income with median household income over $100,000, indicating residents can generally absorb higher transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have significant discretionary spending power and frequently patronize the area's upscale restaurants, bars, and retail establishments along Washington Avenue.
thinking.accessibility: The area has good road access via I-10 and Memorial Drive, decent bus service, and is relatively close to downtown, though most residents are car-dependent despite some walkable areas.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high incomes, prioritized policies that improve transit service and reduce congestion even if costs increase 2) Selected moderate-to-high driver fees to encourage transit use and fund improvements 3) Preferred lower transit fares to incentivize ridership 4) Accepted higher sales tax given ability to afford it 5) Balanced travel time improvements with reasonable cost increases 6) Ranked proposals that provide best overall mobility improvements while maintaining area's economic vitality
